abstract: Municipal government of Chongqing in southwestern China orders all 13 Wal-Mart stores in area to close for 15 days and fines company $420,000 in a labeling dispute that has broader political implications for Western companies operating in nation.
snippet: The retail store also faces fines after regular cuts of pork were sold as organic in Chongqing.
lead_paragraph: The retail store also faces fines after regular cuts of pork were sold as organic in Chongqing.

headline.seo: Wal-Marts in China City Closed for Pork Mislabeling
